dt: {bc}a speech sound or series of speech sounds that symbolizes and communicates a meaning usually without being divisible into smaller units capable of independent use
{bc}the entire set of linguistic forms produced by combining a single base with various inflectional elements without change in the part of speech elements
{bc}a written or printed character or combination of characters representing a spoken word

dt.t: the number of {wi}words{/wi} to a line

dt: sometimes used with the first letter of a real or pretended taboo word prefixed as an often humorous euphemism

dt.t: the first man to utter the f {wi}word{/wi} on British TV
we were not afraid to use the d {wi}word{/wi} and talk about death

dt: {bc}any segment of written or printed discourse ordinarily appearing between spaces or between a space and a punctuation mark

dt.t: would like to have a {wi}word{/wi} with you
putting one's feelings into {wi}words{/wi}

dt: {bc}the text of a vocal musical composition

dt.t: don't move till I give the {wi}word{/wi}
sent {wi}word{/wi} that he would be late
kept her {wi}word{/wi}
they had {wi}words{/wi} and parted

dt: {bc}the expressed or manifested mind and will of God
{bc}the act of speaking or of making verbal communication
{bc}a number of bytes processed as a unit and conveying a quantum of information in communication and computer work

dt.t: put in a {it}good word{/it} for me
what's the {it}good word{/it}
implied that such actions were criminal but did not say so {it}in so many words{/it}
{it}in so many words{/it}, she wasn't fit to be seen

dt: {bc}not inclined to say more than is necessary {bc}{sx|laconic||}

dt.t: a man {it}of few words{/it}

dt: {bc}that can be relied on to keep a promise

dt.t: a man {it}of his word{/it}
{it}upon my word{/it}, I've never heard of such a thing

et: Middle English, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}wort{/it} word, Latin {it}verbum{/it}, Greek {it}eirein{/it} to say, speak, Hittite {it}weriya-{/it} to call, name
shortdef: a speech sound or series of speech sounds that symbolizes and communicates a meaning usually without being divisible into smaller units capable of independent use
the entire set of linguistic forms produced by combining a single base with various inflectional elements without change in the part of speech elements
a written or printed character or combination of characters representing a spoken word —sometimes used with the first letter of a real or pretended taboo word prefixed as an often humorous euphemism

dt.t: a carefully {wi}worded{/wi} reply

dt: used to say that a person does not know what to say

dt.t: He wanted to express his appreciation for all they had done, but {it}words failed him{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that a person does not know what to say

meta.id: a picture is worth a thousand words
stems: a picture is worth a thousand words

hwi.hw: a picture is worth a thousand words

dt: used to say that it is often easier to show something in a picture than to describe it with words

shortdef: —used to say that it is often easier to show something in a picture than to describe it with words

dt: {bc}unable to think of anything to say

dt.t: I was so surprised to see her that I was {it}at a loss for words{/it}.

shortdef: unable to think of anything to say

dt: {bc}to say angry words in an argument {bc}to argue

dt.t: I don't want to {it}bandy words{/it} with you.

shortdef: to say angry words in an argument : to argue

dt: {bc}long words that many people don't know the meaning of

dt.t: I can't understand her writing; she uses too many {it}big words{/it}.

shortdef: long words that many people don't know the meaning of

dt: used to introduce a statement that repeats what has been said in a different and usually a simpler or more exact way

dt.t: "She said the movie was a bit predictable." "{it}In other words{/it}, she didn't like it."

shortdef: —used to introduce a statement that repeats what has been said in a different and usually a simpler or more exact way

dt.t: We explained our views to the press {it}in words of one syllable{/it}.

dt: {bc}unable to think of anything to say

dt.t: I was so surprised to see her that I was {it}lost for words{/it}.

shortdef: unable to think of anything to say
